[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: main()] [Output File Race] Between generating CSV content and writing to modules.csv, can an attacker create a symlink to hijack the output? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info()] [Silent Failure Masking] Using flat_map with .ok() silently drops errors - could critical security failures (e.g., privilege escalation attempts) go undetected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: read_modules()] [Generic Error Message] The 'failed to read file' error loses the original IO error - does this hide security-relevant information like permission denials? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: main()] [Error Context Loss] The ? operator propagates errors up but loses context - could this make debugging security issues more difficult? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Module Dependency Bomb] Can circular or deeply nested module dependencies cause exponential blowup in check_module_complexity()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Struct Layout Attack] Can crafted struct layouts with extreme field counts or nesting cause integer overflow in size calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Generic Type Instantiation Bomb] Can generic types with excessive type parameters cause exponential expansion during complexity analysis? (High)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Ability Constraint Bypass] Can modules with invalid ability constraints bypass Move's type safety and cause undefined behavior in complexity checking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Overall Architecture] [Supply Chain Attack] If this tool is used in CI/CD to validate modules before deployment, can an attacker compromise it to allow malicious modules through? (Critical)
